slokas: अर्जुन उवाचज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन ।तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ॥ १ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Arjuna said: O son of Janārdana, if you think of your actions, O son of January, why do you engage me in this terrible act?
slokas_english: Arjuna said: O son of Janārdana, if you think of your actions, O son of January, why do you engage me in this terrible act? 1

slokas: व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे ।तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्‍नुयाम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): You seem to be confused by my words with your confused words. Please tell me one thing that I shall attain to the welfare of all.
slokas_english: You seem to be confused by my words with your confused words. Please tell me one thing that I shall attain to the welfare of all. 2

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचलोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ ।ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O sinless one, I have already described to you in this world, O sinless one, by the practice of yogīs, by the practice of yogīs.
slokas_english: O sinless one, I have already described to you in this world, O sinless one, by the practice of yogīs, by the practice of yogīs. 3

slokas: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्य पुरुषोऽश्न‍ुते ।न च सन्न्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): A person who does not undertake his actions does not perform any activity, nor does he attain perfection by renunciation. .
slokas_english: A person who does not undertake his actions does not perform any activity, nor does he attain perfection by renunciation. 4.

slokas: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् ।कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): No one ever remains for a moment and does not perform any activity. Everyone is under the control of all the modes of nature by nature.
slokas_english: No one ever remains for a moment and does not perform any activity. Everyone is under the control of all the modes of nature by nature. 5

slokas: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् ।इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): He who controls the senses of action and reminds us of the senses and remembers the objects of the senses and is deluded by the senses of the senses is called a false conductor.
slokas_english: He who controls the senses of action and reminds us of the senses and remembers the objects of the senses and is deluded by the senses of the senses is called a false conductor. 6

slokas: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन ।कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O Arjuna, a person who is unattached to the senses of action and the senses of action, who is engaged in controlling the senses by the mind, is superior.
slokas_english: O Arjuna, a person who is unattached to the senses of action and the senses of action, who is engaged in controlling the senses by the mind, is superior. 7

slokas: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः ।शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): You should perform your duty as a fixed action and you are better than inaction. Even if you have a journey of your body, you will not be known for your inaction.
slokas_english: You should perform your duty as a fixed action and you are better than inaction. Even if you have a journey of your body, you will not be known for your inaction. 8

slokas: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः ।तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O son of Kunti, this world is bound by action for the sake of performing sacrifices, O son of Kunti. .
slokas_english: O son of Kunti, this world is bound by action for the sake of performing sacrifices, O son of Kunti. 9.

slokas: सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः ।अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Having created the living entities with the sacrifices of the living entities the creator of the universe said to him .
slokas_english: Having created the living entities with the sacrifices of the living entities the creator of the universe said to him 10.

slokas: देवान्भावयतातेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः ।परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): By thinking of the demigods may those devatas feel you and you will attain the highest good by feeling for each other. .
slokas_english: By thinking of the demigods may those devatas feel you and you will attain the highest good by feeling for each other. 11.

slokas: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः ।तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): He who enjoys the pleasures of the demigods will give you the pleasures he desires for those who are devoted to the sacrifice and who enjoys what they have given them
slokas_english: He who enjoys the pleasures of the demigods will give you the pleasures he desires for those who are devoted to the sacrifice and who enjoys what they have given them 12

slokas: यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषै ।भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Those who eat the remains of the sacrifice are freed from all sins and enjoy the sins of the sinners who cook for their own sake
slokas_english: Those who eat the remains of the sacrifice are freed from all sins and enjoy the sins of the sinners who cook for their own sake 13

slokas: अन्नाद्भ‍वन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः ।यज्ञा‍द्भ‍‍वति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भ‍वः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): From food comes all living entities and from the rain comes food. From the sacrifice, the rain is the source of all activities.
slokas_english: From food comes all living entities and from the rain comes food. From the sacrifice, the rain is the source of all activities. 14

slokas: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भ‍वं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भ‍वम् ।तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Know that action is the source of the Absolute Truth and is the source of all knowledge.
slokas_english: Know that action is the source of the Absolute Truth and is the source of all knowledge. 15

slokas: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः ।अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O son of Pṛthā, whoever does not follow the wheel in this world in this world, O son of Pṛthā, will live in vain and enjoy the senses.
slokas_english: O son of Pṛthā, whoever does not follow the wheel in this world in this world, O son of Pṛthā, will live in vain and enjoy the senses. 16

slokas: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्त‍श्च मानवः ।आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): A human being who is satisfied with himself and who is satisfied with himself has no need of his duties .
slokas_english: A human being who is satisfied with himself and who is satisfied with himself has no need of his duties 17.

slokas: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन ।न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): There is no need for him in this world and no one in all living beings in this world
slokas_english: There is no need for him in this world and no one in all living beings in this world 18

slokas: तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर ।असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्‍नोति पूरूषः ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Therefore, a person who is not attached to it should always perform his duties and perform his duties. .
slokas_english: Therefore, a person who is not attached to it should always perform his duties and perform his duties. 19.

slokas: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः ।लोकसङ्ग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥ २० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Janaka and others who have attained perfection by their actions are the only ones who have attained perfection even when they see even the collection of the worlds
slokas_english: Janaka and others who have attained perfection by their actions are the only ones who have attained perfection even when they see even the collection of the worlds 20

slokas: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः ।स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Whatever the best person performs is the same as that of others.
slokas_english: Whatever the best person performs is the same as that of others. 21

slokas: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन ।नानवाप्त‍मवाप्त‍व्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): I have nothing to do in the three worlds, O son of Pṛthā.
slokas_english: I have nothing to do in the three worlds, O son of Pṛthā. 22

slokas: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः ।मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): If I am never lazy in my actions, O son of Pṛthā, I am never lazy in my actions, O son of Pṛthā, in every way.
slokas_english: If I am never lazy in my actions, O son of Pṛthā, I am never lazy in my actions, O son of Pṛthā, in every way. 23

slokas: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् ।सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): If I do not perform any activity of these living entities, I shall destroy these living entities. I shall destroy these living beings.
slokas_english: If I do not perform any activity of these living entities, I shall destroy these living entities. I shall destroy these living beings. 24

slokas: सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत ।कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसङ्‍‍ग्रहम् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O descendant of Bharata who are attached to the activities of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is not attached to the activities of the demigods, one should perform the rituals of acquiring the planetary activities of the Lord. .
slokas_english: O descendant of Bharata who are attached to the activities of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is not attached to the activities of the demigods, one should perform the rituals of acquiring the planetary activities of the Lord. 25.

slokas: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् ।जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन् ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): A learned person should not cause differences in intelligence to those who are ignorant and associated with actions .
slokas_english: A learned person should not cause differences in intelligence to those who are ignorant and associated with actions 26.

slokas: प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः ।अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The modes of nature of the modes of nature performed by the modes of nature performed by the modes of nature are confused by the ego of egoism
slokas_english: The modes of nature of the modes of nature performed by the modes of nature performed by the modes of nature are confused by the ego of egoism 27

slokas: तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः ।गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्ज‍ते ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O mighty-armed one, the knowledge of the Absolute Truth is not prepared to think that the modes of nature are present in the modes of nature. .
slokas_english: O mighty-armed one, the knowledge of the Absolute Truth is not prepared to think that the modes of nature are present in the modes of nature. 28.

slokas: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्ज‍न्ते गुणकर्मसु ।तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Those who are deluded by the modes of nature of nature are attached to the modes of nature, and those who know the whole of the Vedas should not move about in the whole world. .
slokas_english: Those who are deluded by the modes of nature of nature are attached to the modes of nature, and those who know the whole of the Vedas should not move about in the whole world. 29.

slokas: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा ।निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Having renounced all my activities in Me with the mind of the spiritual master, you should fight without any disraction and free from attachment and fever. .
slokas_english: Having renounced all my activities in Me with the mind of the spiritual master, you should fight without any disraction and free from attachment and fever. 30.

slokas: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः ।श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Those human beings who always follow this opinion of Me are also freed from their faith and are not jealous of them.
slokas_english: Those human beings who always follow this opinion of Me are also freed from their faith and are not jealous of them. 31

slokas: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् ।सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Those who are jealous of this do not follow My opinion and know that they are deluded by all knowledge
slokas_english: Those who are jealous of this do not follow My opinion and know that they are deluded by all knowledge 32

slokas: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि ।प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Even though he is aware of his own nature he acts like a person who is aware of his own nature He goes to nature what will he do to restrain his nature .
slokas_english: Even though he is aware of his own nature he acts like a person who is aware of his own nature He goes to nature what will he do to restrain his nature 33.

slokas: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ ।तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The two senses of passion and hatred are established in the sense of the senses, and the two are obstructed by the senses.
slokas_english: The two senses of passion and hatred are established in the sense of the senses, and the two are obstructed by the senses. 34

slokas: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् ।स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): It is better for one’s own religion to be free from the customs of others than the duty of others. .
slokas_english: It is better for one’s own religion to be free from the customs of others than the duty of others. 35.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचअथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः ।अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Arjuna said: Then by whom this sinful man is committed by him, even though he does not wish to do so, O Vārṣṇa, as if he were engaged in force. .
slokas_english: Arjuna said: Then by whom this sinful man is committed by him, even though he does not wish to do so, O Vārṣṇa, as if he were engaged in force. 36.

slokas: श्री भगवानुवाचकाम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भ‍वः ।महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The Supreme Personality of Godhead, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, said: This anger, which is the source of all passion, is the source of all the modes of passion. .
slokas_english: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, said: This anger, which is the source of all passion, is the source of all the modes of passion. 37.

slokas: धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च ।यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृत्तम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): Just as a fire is covered with smoke as a mirror is covered with dirt, so the embryo is covered by the floor. .
slokas_english: Just as a fire is covered with smoke as a mirror is covered with dirt, so the embryo is covered by the floor. 38.

slokas: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा ।कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O son of Kunti O son of Kunti you are always enveloped in knowledge by this knowledge of the Supreme Personality of Godhead by this knowledge of the Supreme Personality of Godhead .
slokas_english: O son of Kunti O son of Kunti you are always enveloped in knowledge by this knowledge of the Supreme Personality of Godhead by this knowledge of the Supreme Personality of Godhead 39.

slokas: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते ।एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम् ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): The senses, the mind, the intellect and the position of the body are called the embodiment of knowledge.
slokas_english: The senses, the mind, the intellect and the position of the body are called the embodiment of knowledge. 40

slokas: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ ।पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O best of the Bhāratas, please control this material world by controlling the senses. Please destroy this knowledge of knowledge. .
slokas_english: O best of the Bhāratas, please control this material world by controlling the senses. Please destroy this knowledge of knowledge. 41.

slokas: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः ।मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): They say that the senses are superior to the senses and the mind is superior to the senses. The mind is the supreme intelligence which is beyond the intellect.
slokas_english: They say that the senses are superior to the senses and the mind is superior to the senses. The mind is the supreme intelligence which is beyond the intellect. 42

slokas: एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना ।जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_english(no numbers): O mighty-armed one, having thus understood the supreme intelligence of your intellect, you must kill your enemy in the form of lust. .
slokas_english: O mighty-armed one, having thus understood the supreme intelligence of your intellect, you must kill your enemy in the form of lust. 43.
